newsitem.title: CANADA: CANADA DOLLAR ENDS SOFTER AHEAD OF KEY JOBS DATA.
newsitem.headline: CANADA DOLLAR ENDS SOFTER AHEAD OF KEY JOBS DATA.

text.p: * Canada's dollar ended softer at C$1.3885 (US$0.7202) on Thursday from Wednesday close at C$1.3870 (US$0.7209) after a quiet session * Traders said the unit is expected to take direction from Canada July employment data due on Friday
* Currency seen trading quietly between C$1.3860 and C$1.3900 overnight, traders said.
"I wouldn't think it would stay below C$1.3900 going into Friday's numbers," the trader said.

A Reuters forecast of economists predicted employment would grow by 35,500 in July after an increase of 52,000 in June. The same survey said Canada's unemployment rate would remain unchanged at 9.1 percent.

Some analysts said the jobs data may spark some buying interest in the Canadian dollar. "The follow-through selling in Europe overnight was very light, and that suggests that the majority still want to buy the Canadian dollar back," said Rob Palombi, economist with MMS International.
"The Canadian jobs data out tomorrow morning could be a perfect opportunity for them to do that," Palombi added.
On the crosses, the Canadian dollar dipped to 85.27 Japanese yen from Wednesday's 85.63 yen and fell to 1.3455 marks from Wednesday's 1.3563 marks.
